Laptop.potential_reason: Dead battery or faulty power supply.
Laptop.solution: 1) Check if the laptop is plugged in and the power adapter is working. 2) Remove the battery and try powering on with just the adapter. 3) If still not working, the issue may be with the motherboard or other internal components.

Laptop.potential_reason: Dust buildup or faulty cooling system.
Laptop.solution: 1) Clean the air vents and fans with compressed air. 2) Replace thermal paste between CPU/GPU and heatsink. 3) If the issue persists, the cooling fan or heatsink may need to be replaced.

LCD Screen.potential_reason: Physical damage from impact or pressure.
LCD Screen.solution: 1) Replace the entire LCD panel. 2) Ensure proper handling and protection for the laptop to prevent future damage.

LCD Screen.potential_reason: Loose or faulty video cable connection.
LCD Screen.solution: 1) Reseat the video cable connection between the LCD panel and motherboard. 2) If the issue persists, replace the video cable or LCD panel.

Hard Drive.solution: 1) Run a disk defragmentation utility. 2) Back up data and replace the hard drive if the issue persists or errors are reported.

Hard Drive.potential_reason: Logical or physical hard drive failure.
Hard Drive.solution: 1) Attempt data recovery using specialized software or services. 2) Replace the hard drive and restore data from backups if available.

RAM.issue: System crashes or blue screen errors
RAM.solution: 1) Reseat the RAM modules and ensure they are properly installed. 2) Replace the RAM module if the issue persists.
1) Close unnecessary applications to free up RAM. 2) Upgrade the RAM capacity if the issue persists.

Battery.solution: 1) Calibrate the battery by fully draining and recharging it. 2) Replace the battery if the issue persists.

1) Try a different charger or charging cable. 2) Check for any debris or damage in the charging port and clean it if necessary. 3) If the issue persists, the charging port or battery may need to be replaced.
